snippet: A clerical error means that the Manhattan block that is home to Mr. Carlin’s childhood church will temporarily bear the name of the merrily vulgar comic who relentlessly skewered it.
abstract: New York City bill is signed into law finally declaring that two-block stretch of West 121st Street is named George Carlin Way; name will temporarily include street that is home to Corpus Christi Church, which Carlin attended as a child and later mocked in his comedy routines, due to clerical error; compromise came about after years of community board hearings and negotiations between comedians and church members.
lead_paragraph: A clerical error means that the Manhattan block that is home to Mr. Carlin’s childhood church will temporarily bear the name of the merrily vulgar comic who relentlessly skewered it.

headline.main: An Error Puts a Church on George Carlin Way
headline.print_headline: An Error Puts a Church on George Carlin Way
